body_html: @F3PiX from what I remember to have seen, you should be right. Bootstrap's way to go is wrapping a navbar (e.g. using navbar navbar-default) around a container. For the Teams app it's the other way round: a container / row containing a navelement.
body_text: @F3PiX from what I remember to have seen, you should be right. Bootstrap's way to go is wrapping  a navbar (e.g. using navbar navbar-default) around a container. For the Teams app it's the other way round: a container / row containing a navelement.
body: @F3PiX from what I remember to have seen, you should be right. Bootstrap's way to go is wrapping  a navbar (e.g. using `navbar navbar-default`) around a container. For the Teams app it's the other way round: a container / row containing a `nav`element.
